intro: Lindernia anagallidea, commonly known as the silverleaf lindernia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is known for its adaptability to arid conditions. Lindernia anagallidea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
